@lynn_laidlaw @DerekCStewart Maybe the next project you supervise! 😉 #Involvement_Preclinical

@eczemasupport @DerekCStewart @lynn_laidlaw It would improve so much as well as the quality of the research - communication skills of the trainee, a new perspective that builds respect for the value of the work, understanding on what matters to patients etc. Wish unis had it as standard!  #Involvement_Preclinical
@lynn_laidlaw @DerekCStewart 1000000%. https://t.co/t307Na0fKx

@DerekCStewart Having a patient embedded in a supervisory team throughout the training process, would have a massive impact (@lynn_laidlaw doing this but not preclinical if my memory serves me right..). Needs uni structures to catch up re: payment etc. #Involvement_Preclinical

@TO_dpr @UCD_PPI_Ignite @lynn_laidlaw @bellastarling @DerekCStewart That's true, I do think it's starting to change which is good to see. Can't wait for the day we see meaningful PPI as a standard part of the process just as ethical approval or quality data analysis etc. We can hope!  #Involvement_Preclinical

@DerekCStewart @TO_dpr @lynn_laidlaw @bellastarling Thanks Derek! Joining the conversation as someone who left lab-based research because I didn't feel it was patient-focussed enough..  #Involvement_Preclinical

@lynn_laidlaw @bellastarling @TO_dpr @DerekCStewart I think we can, it needs really good communication and expectation setting etc - training and shared learning for all involved. I think it would make lab-based scientists more understanding of the impact (and limitations) of their results. #Involvement_Preclinical

@TO_dpr @lynn_laidlaw @bellastarling @DerekCStewart When talking to friends who are lab-based researchers it doesn't seem that PPI is mentioned in training programmes for ECRs either. When I talk about working with patients it's an alien concept.  #Involvement_Preclinical

@lynn_laidlaw @TO_dpr @DerekCStewart Totally agree, Lynn! We I was lab-based we worked with brain samples and the only information we had was sex and age. Nothing else. Felt very strange (and not good!) to disconnect the person from the sample.  #Involvement_Preclinical

@mdimairo You are human, we all have biases.

Bad behaviour is bad behaviour. Questioning someone's mental state as a result of that bad behaviour is unnecessary and damaging to people that have experience with paranoia and other mental health conditions. Poor mental health does not equal violence. #StopPutin

We saw it with Trump and now we're seeing it with Putin. Please don't question their mental state. It won't make a difference to them, but it will deeply hurt  people that have experienced mental ill health, and those are the people that will see your comments. #MentalHealth
@mdimairo Please Munya, question your own assumptions and biases here. It's not just me you will have offended, it's anyone who has and will have experience of mental ill health.

@mdimairo That's the problem. He's a poor leader and is doing terrible things - the fact that you are now questioning his mental state is damaging. People can and do do bad things without mental ill health being a factor, and it's unfair to equate bad behaviour with mental ill health.

@mdimairo We cannot know Putin's mental state, and it's incredibly damaging to people living with mental ill health to equate these conditions with violence. I understand your thought process, but it's not a fair assumption to make.

Others have said it, but I’ll say it again. The way this pandemic is being dealt with (i.e. not at all) is horrendous.
The thought that ‘everyone will eventually get covid so we’ve got to learn to live with it’ is eugenics.
Disabled people are dying.

I’m also angry because the person she supports is the very person that restrictions, legislation etc should keep safe. Mask wearing in England is terrifying low, this person cannot wear a mask and others have not done their bit to protect them.

As I said, my Mum works hard. She’s truly exhausted. She regularly comes home from work in the morning, falls asleep on the sofa with coat and shoes still on, and then goes back in for another shift that evening. Post-chemo life is tough and she hasn’t been able to slow down.

My Mum will now need to work a minimum of 5 days in a row with the person to ensure that if it is covid (testing isn’t an option), no one else is exposed. I am angry and upset and worried for both this person, and my Mum.

Now, the person she supports is showing covid symptoms. This person has been vaccinated (including booster) but cannot wear a mask, cannot social distance, and cannot take individual responsibility for a pandemic they has no understanding of.

We didn’t see her at Christmas last year. I didn’t see her on my birthday. She went through chemotherapy alone. This year, her colleagues covered Christmas so she could have some time off to see family. She finished work at 10am on Christmas eve, and was back at 10am on the 27th.

My Mum works harder than anyone I know. She’s a support worker, and went back to work after living through cancer during the pandemic as soon as she was given the go ahead by her oncologist. She got vaccinated early like many other frontline workers.

Anyway, remind me again next time this happens: I need to write the protocol in a standard way, and then immediately write a version as if it's made for a toddler. Little chunks and baby steps to make the big thing. If I don't do that I get incredibly overwhelmed.

I went through the symptoms and reasons why I'm almost certain I have ADHD, how it links with my depression - the patterns I've been seeing since I realised etc. Shocker, I'm almost certain my Mum has it too 😂 we are truly the same person.

My Mum and I are are SO alike. We sound the same on the phone, we look the same (apart from I'm 5'8 and she's 5'3). We work in the same way. The best way to describe her is essentially a physically concentrated version of me - wittier, funnier, shorter.

Medication isn't for everyone, but holy cow, when it works, it WORKS. Don't be ashamed to ask for help, or to go back and ask for further help if things aren't working for you anymore. Depression is a complex beast, and it can suck the fight out of you. Please fight back 💛

Now I'm feeling like *myself* again, I'm powering through things I've been pushing around my notebook and avoiding in my inbox for weeks/months. I am excited about my work, I am excited about what I'm doing and producing, and I have a life outside of non-work guilt!

It makes me think that the sertraline had worn off much earlier than I'd realised, I just hadn't noticed the gradual loss of function in my day to day life. Getting out of bed was difficult, but I thought I was a normal level of tired rather than depression-level energy drained.

I am stunned by how functional I am at the moment. Things are stressy at home with a lot going on, Cameron's car crash last night etc, but I am fine. Dealing with stuff, getting on with projects, walking the dog, making real food etc.

[CW depression/medication chat]

I figured I should update, given how many of you helped and gave (requested) advice when I was going through sertraline withdrawals. 
I've been on a new medication (escitalopram) for 5 weeks now, and all sertraline withdrawal effects have gone 🥳

I know this is like a weird internalised ableism because of course capitalism says your productivity dictates your worth, but ugh, it's tough to just allow yourself to be a pool of depression without it damaging your perception of who you are.
It's so frustrating. I'm 29 years old, I have a PhD, I own a house, and yet today I woke up when my alarm went off and despite having 9 hours sleep, I had to have a nap before the day even started.

Sometimes I am completely dissociated from the world. Today I made and ate lunch and couldn't remember doing either. Some days are a complete blur, which is not ideal if I've got meetings or y'know, actual things to do.

It feels like people don't talk about the day-to-day of mental health issues much. The words depression and anxiety are thrown around often, and 'it's good to talk', but in practice, I'm struggling to talk because my brain fog is refusing to remember words to explain how I feel.

I'm so angry that depression is even a thing. I know people have it worse, I get it, but depression is the thing that's taking over my life right now. I have so many ideas and things I want to do, but I am either sleeping or my brain is sleeping while my body is awake.

I wish that the majority of people would understand that persecuting Travellers, warning against them, is racist. Just because you live in a house without wheels does not make you better than a group of people that live in homes with them.

Full disclosure: My Grandad's Mum, my Nana, was a Traveller. In her adult life she settled and lived in a house, but Travellers are a significant part of my heritage. I do my best to stand up for people of all backgrounds and ethnicities, and Travellers are included in that.
These communities are still being persecuted - and apparently it's socially acceptable to do so. I am angry.
During the Second World War, approximately one quarter (250,000) of the Roma population of Europe was exterminated by the Nazis in an act known as the ‘Porrajmos’—the Gypsy Holocaust.

Traveller people have historically been persecuted across Europe, with every modern EU state having anti-'Gypsy' laws at some point. In the 16th century a law was passed in England that allowed the state to imprison, execute or banish anyone that was perceived to be a 'Gypsy'.

Traveller communities (whether Roma, Irish or British) experience the worst outcomes of any ethnic group across a huge range of areas, including education, health, employment, criminal justice and hate crime.
There was about 50 comments underneath the original post thanking this person for the warning. THE WARNING.

Someone posted on a community Facebook group 'warning' that there are travellers pitching up near the town. This person advised people to 'clear gardens of anything of value' and 'don't walk dogs off lead'.

I've had a large cup of tea and been for a walk and I'm still angry.

I am happy to share my experience with those looking to start their own business. When those people stab me in the back and work hard not on their own designs, but on making my designs look just different enough that I can't claim a copyright infringement, it hurts.

I found some counterfeits, and then some of her products came up in my search too. She's now literally seeing which products sell well for me, and then recreating them in her own style. I am so frustrated by this, but mostly I'm upset.

Since she started her business, everything has been just different enough from my products for it not to bother me. Today I did my fortnightly sweep of Etsy for people selling counterfeits of my products (this happens all the time and it's maddening).

A PhD student started a business about 2 years after I started mine. She bought my products, she emailed asking for advice, and I gave her my time because I thought she was just like me - someone wanting to build a creative business that would help people to share science.

I am tired that women around the world are consistently limited, victimised, victim-blamed, demonised, bullied, brutalised, and killed. I am tired of trying to work against it, or trying to change things for myself and others. I am tired.

I am tired of knowing that certain decisions or impacts are the result of the patriarchal society that we live in. I am tired of people accepting that and allowing it to continue. I am tired that my experience is likely the ‘best’ on a scale of badness.

I am tired of being referred to as my partner’s girlfriend rather than my own name. I am tired of weight being something that people comment on more than my personality, intellect or achievements. I am tired of today being used to showcase the achievements of white women.

I am tired of seeing women in the media being objectified and shamed for any and every decision they make. I am tired of being asked when I will get married. I am tired of being asked when I will have children.

I haven’t talked about #IWD2021 today, because I am too exhausted. I’m tired of being asked to do things for free. I’m tired of being asked to donate products I have created and paid for to causes that supposedly empower women.
